name: Abhiram Ranade
content: Abhiram G. Ranade Professor (Retired) Department of Computer Science and Engineering Indian Institute of Technology, Powai, Mumbai 400076, India E-mail: ranade [AT] cse.iitb.ac.in Research interests: Algorithms. Combinatorial Optimization. Internships: Read this first. Recent Papers: Scheduling Trains with Small Stretch on a Unidirectional Line CALDAM 2021. Complexity, bounds and dynamic programming algorithms for single track train scheduling Annals of Operations Research, February 2019. Earlier version in MISTA 2015. A new formulation and a column generation-based heuristic for the multiple depot vehicle scheduling problem Transportation Research Part B: Methodological, December 2018. A new two-stage heuristic for the recreational vehicle scheduling problem Computers & Operations Research, March 2018. Train Scheduling on a Unidirectional Path. In FSTTCS 2017. Branch & Bound Global-Search Algorithm for Aircraft Ground Movement Optimization Journal of Aerospace Information Systems, June 2017. Earlier version in Aviation 2014. A Linear Programming Based Iterative Heuristic for the Recreational Vehicle Scheduling problem In IEEM 2016. Introductory Programming: Let Us Cut through the Clutter! In ITiCSE 2016. Fragmented coloring of proper interval and split graphs Discrete Applied Mathematics, October 2015. DrawCAD: Mouse-sketch-based engineering drawing In APCHI 2013. Scheduling light-trails on WDM rings Journal of Parallel and Distributed Computing, October 2012. An Improved Maximum Likelihood Formulation for Genome Assembly. In ICCABS 2011. Education related writing: Report to AICTE of the ACM India Task force on Introductory Programming Higher education: Promotion policies at the centre of declining standards, Indian Express, Jan 5, 2016.
